---
title: "Make your plot Hylian"
---


Here are the 5 steps you need to make your plot a hylian one!! May the triforce be with you!

1. Download the [*Triforce* font](https://zeldauniverse.net/media/fonts/)

2. Open R and install showtext if not install

```{r, eval=FALSE}
install.package(showtext)
```

3. To see the list of font available locally do so

```{r}
library(showtext)
showtext.auto()
font.files()
```

4. Add *Hylia Serif* to your session

```{r}
font.add(family = 'Hylian', regular = 'HylianSymbols.ttf')
font.add(family = 'Triforce', regular = 'Triforce.ttf')
```

5. Use it!

```{r}
par(family="Triforce")
plot(c(0,1), c(0,1), type="n", xlab="X-axis", ylab="Y-axis", main="Hylian style")
points(runif(10), runif(10), pch="*")
```
